claims.statement: High f_HKII occupancy stabilizes VDAC1 monomers, suppressing oligomerization-dependent mtDNA release and cGAS-STING activation, contributing to immune-cold phenotype.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Specifies HK-II knockdown failing to increase cytoplasmic mtDNA or cGAS-STING signaling as disproof.
claims.feasible_reason: HK-II knockdown uses standard siRNA/shRNA in cell culture with qPCR/Western blot for mtDNA/STING readouts.
claims.novel_reason: Links f_HKII to immune-cold phenotype via VDAC oligomerization, enabling stratification of tumors for gate-jamming tests.

claims.statement: The Warburg effect and immune evasion are mechanistically coupled through VDAC gating — the same molecular investments (HK-II recruitment, cholesterol enrichment) that optimize glycolysis simultaneously prevent immune visibility.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Disproved by Warburg-high, high f_HKII tumors showing active cGAS-STING and immune-hot status.
claims.feasible_reason: Assess Warburg (glucose uptake, lactate), f_HKII (co-IP), and cGAS-STING (reporter assays) in cell lines/tumoroids.
claims.novel_reason: Couples Warburg to immune evasion via VDAC gating, predicting testable metabolic-immune correlations.

claims.statement: Gate-restoring drugs (HK-II displacers + navitoclax-class Bcl-xL inhibitors) will synergize with anti-PD-1 specifically in immune-cold tumors with high f_HKII.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No differential benefit or failure to increase TILs in cold vs hot tumors disproves synergy.
claims.feasible_reason: Requires in vivo combination therapy testing with stratification and TIL quantification beyond standard lab methods.
claims.novel_reason: Predicts tumor-type-specific synergy, guiding combo screen protocols in cold tumor models.

claims.statement: f_HKII occupancy and Chol/CL ratio from tumor biopsies can serve as predictive biomarkers for immunotherapy response, with high values predicting resistance.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No correlation in retrospective biopsy cohorts disproves biomarker utility.
claims.feasible_reason: Needs large clinical biopsy cohorts with IHC/quantitative assays and response tracking, not standard lab.
claims.novel_reason: Proposes direct biopsy metrics for IO resistance, enabling patient stratification hypothesis.

claims.statement: Gate-jamming (high f_HKII, f_BclxL, Chol/CL) predicts immune-cold tumors by preventing VDAC1 oligomerization and mtDNA-cGAS-STING activation.
claims.falsifiable_reason: High jamming with high cGAS-STING or low jamming with cold phenotype disproves prediction.
claims.feasible_reason: Quantify jamming factors (binding assays), VDAC state (crosslinking), and STING (phospho-blots) in cell lines.
claims.novel_reason: Core prediction tying gate-jamming quantitatively to cold tumors for multi-factor testing.

claims.statement: Pharmacological gate-restoration (HK-II displacement + Bcl-xL inhibition) will convert immune-cold tumors to immune-hot and synergize with checkpoint inhibitors.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Failure to boost STING/TILs or synergize with checkpoint inhibitors disproves conversion.
claims.feasible_reason: In vivo tumor models with drug combos, infiltration assays, and synergy metrics exceed standard cell culture.
claims.novel_reason: Specifies gate-restoration mechanism for hot conversion, testable in stratified preclinical screens.

claims.statement: f_HKII occupancy or Chol/CL ratio in tumor biopsies can predict immunotherapy response.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No correlation in studies between metrics and IO response disproves prediction.
claims.feasible_reason: Relies on biopsy cohorts and clinical response data, requiring prospective/retrospective analysis.
claims.novel_reason: Quantifies biomarker thresholds for IO, advancing personalized prediction protocol.

claims.statement: Warburg metabolism (high glycolysis) is causally linked to immune evasion via gate-jamming.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Glycolytic tumors with low jamming/immune-hot or non-glycolytic with high jamming disproves link.
claims.feasible_reason: Measure glycolysis (ECAR), f_HKII (binding), VDAC state, and immune markers in cell lines.
claims.novel_reason: Causal glycolysis-to-jamming pathway predicts flux-dependent immune tests.

claims.statement: Checkpoint inhibitors alone are ineffective in gate-jammed tumors due to lack of pre-existing immune visibility.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Gate-jammed tumors responding to checkpoint alone disproves invisibility requirement.
claims.feasible_reason: Test jammed cell lines (high f_HKII) for PD-1 response in co-culture or syngeneic models.
claims.novel_reason: Explains IO paradox via gate state, falsifiable in cold tumor IO assays.

claims.statement: Gate-jamming (high f_HKII/f_BclxL/Chol/CL) predicts immune-cold tumors by blocking VDAC1 oligomerization and mtDNA-cGAS-STING.
claims.falsifiable_reason: High jamming in immune-hot tumors (high TIL/PDL1) disproves prediction.
claims.feasible_reason: Correlate biopsy IHC for factors with TIL/PDL1 in cell lines or xenografts.
claims.novel_reason: Multi-factor jamming score predicts hot/cold, enabling composite biomarker.

claims.statement: Pharmacological gate-restoration (HKII displacement + BclxL inhibition) can convert immune-cold to hot tumors via forced VDAC oligomerization/mtDNA release.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Combo fails to increase STING/TILs in cold models disproves conversion.
claims.feasible_reason: In vivo cold models with drug treatment and signaling/infiltration readouts not standard.
claims.novel_reason: Independent mtDNA trigger via gate-restoration for cold tumors.

claims.statement: Gate-restoration + checkpoint inhibitors synergize specifically in immune-cold tumors, resolving PD1/PDL1 paradox.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No combo benefit over checkpoint in cold tumors disproves synergy.
claims.feasible_reason: Clinical trial-level testing of specificity in cold tumors infeasible in lab.
claims.novel_reason: Resolves paradox with cold-specific combo prediction.

claims.statement: f_HKII occupancy or Chol/CL ratio from biopsies predicts poor immunotherapy response.
claims.falsifiable_reason: High metrics but high IO response disproves biomarker.
claims.feasible_reason: Patient cohorts with pre-treatment metrics and IO outcomes not lab-based.
claims.novel_reason: Cofactor equation stratifies unresponsive cold tumors.

claims.statement: High Warburg/glycolysis (↑ HKII recruitment) jams VDAC gate, explaining immune-coldness in metabolically active tumors.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Glycolytic tumors with low f_HKII but cold profile disproves jamming role.
claims.feasible_reason: Flux assays, f_HKII binding, and immune profiling in glycolytic lines.
claims.novel_reason: Flux-driven f_HKII increase explains metabolic coldness.

claims.statement: High VDAC1 occupancy by Hexokinase-II (f_HKII) and/or a high membrane Chol/CL ratio in tumor biopsies are strong predictive biomarkers for primary resistance to PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibitors.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No correlation in multi-center cohorts disproves biomarker.
claims.feasible_reason: Large-scale patient study with pre-treatment assays infeasible.
claims.novel_reason: Strong metrics for primary resistance, testable retrospectively.

claims.statement: Pharmacological VDAC1 gate-restoration will synergize with checkpoint inhibitors, primarily by converting non-responders into responders.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No superior efficacy in cold mouse models disproves synergy.
claims.feasible_reason: Syngeneic models with combo therapy beyond standard cell work.
claims.novel_reason: Converts non-responders via initial STING signal.

claims.statement: The Warburg effect is a dual-purpose adaptation, providing metabolic support for proliferation while actively enforcing immune evasion through VDAC1 gate-jamming.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Warburg-hot tumor with active cGAS-STING despite VDAC jamming disproves dual role.
claims.feasible_reason: Identify/profile Warburg lines for STING independent of VDAC.
claims.novel_reason: Warburg as built-in evasion via HK-II, linking proliferation-immunity.

claims.statement: High fractional occupancy of VDAC1 by HK-II and Bcl-xL, plus a high Chol/CL ratio, predicts immune-cold tumors by preventing VDAC1 oligomerization and mtDNA-driven cGAS-STING activation.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Hot tumors with high occupancy/cholesterol or cold with low disproves prediction.
claims.feasible_reason: Binding assays, lipidomics, VDAC crosslinking, mtDNA/cytosol in lines.
claims.novel_reason: Composite jamming predicts coldness core to program.

claims.statement: Pharmacological displacement of HK-II and inhibition of Bcl-xL will synergize with PD-1/PD-L1 blockade specifically in immune-cold tumors, but not in already immune-hot tumors.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No added benefit in cold tumors vs checkpoint alone disproves specificity.
claims.feasible_reason: Trial showing stratification-specific effects not lab-feasible.
claims.novel_reason: Signal 1 creation for cold-specific synergy.

claims.statement: The f_HKII (HK-II occupancy) or Chol/CL ratio from tumor biopsies can serve as a predictive biomarker for intrinsic resistance to checkpoint inhibitor monotherapy.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No correlation in prospective study with response rate disproves.
claims.feasible_reason: Prospective clinical study required.
claims.novel_reason: Direct metrics for baseline STING probability.

claims.statement: The Warburg effect promotes immune evasion not only via lactate but also by increasing HK-II binding to VDAC1, directly jamming the mtDNA leak pathway.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Warburg tumors with severed HK-II-VDAC remaining cold disproves direct jamming.
claims.feasible_reason: Genetic mutants (HK-II binding-deficient) in Warburg lines for immune assays.
claims.novel_reason: Direct glycolytic link beyond lactate to mtDNA pathway.

recommendation: Lab Gate PASSED with filter. 10/21 claims cleared. 11 filtered: 'Gate-restoring drugs (HK-II displacers + navitocla...' not feasible; 'f_HKII occupancy and Chol/CL ratio from tumor biop...' not feasible; 'Pharmacological gate-restoration (HK-II displaceme...' not feasible
